name: Sophos
description: The Polarity Sophos integration allows Polarity to search Sophos to return found domains, urls, IPs, and SHA256 hashes.  The integration also allows you to isolate found endpoints, and add SHA256 hashes to your Block and Allow Lists.

options.name: Data Region Url
options.description: The Data Region Url for your Tenant ID.

options.name: Tenant ID
options.description: The Tenant ID you wish to use in searching.

options.name: Client ID
options.description: The Client ID for your Sophos Credentials.  (accessible at https://central.sophos.com/manage/config/settings/credentials)

options.name: Client Secret
options.description: The Client Secret For your Sophos Credentials.

options.name: Allow Block Listing, Allow Listing, and Endpoint Isolation
options.description: This allows you to add SHA256 hashes to Allow and Block lists, and Isolate found endpoints.

options.name: Check Isolation Status
options.description: If unchecked we will not check to see if an Endpoint is already Isolated unless you attempt to Isolate an Endpoint. This reduces the amount of API calls and lessens your chances of hitting your API Limit.

options.name: Check SHA256 Hashes in Block and Allow Lists
options.description: If unchecked we will not check to see if a SHA256 hash is already in an Allow/Block list. This reduces the amount of API calls and lessens your chances of hitting your API Limit.

options.name: Allow and Block List Cache Time
options.description: If a SHA256 hash is submitted to an Allow or Block List outside of this integration, this is the amount of time it will take before we register that update in our search. The longer this time, the less calls to the API are needed, lessening your chances of hitting your API Limit. (Unit is in Minutes)
